verbose_text: The imidazolium based solvent clearly possesses some Bronsted acidity which catalyses certain reactions to a limited extent (e. g., hydrolysis of glycosidic bonds, dehydration into HMF), but this solvent derived acidity is insufficient to catalyse the transformation of cellulose into products.3 On the other hand, DES systems based on ChCl / oxalic acid or ChCl / TsOH promoted more comprehensive transformation of MCC under the selected reaction conditions (conversion up to 46%, Table XREF_TABLE, entries 2 and 4) but mostly into undesirable high molecular weight humins (even though MCC remained as a suspension in the DES).
